website_summaries.verdict: One of the best thin bezel general computer monitors with high-end built-in speakers.
pros: Built-in speakers offer plenty of high audio quality for media applications and gaming
Colors look good when playing games or watching video on the monitor
cons: The speakers can be on the quieter side for some videos, games, and other media

customer_reviews.title: If it's too good to be true it probable is
customer_reviews.text: If it's too good to be true it probable is. Several pixel spots on the screen, so I am returning it tomorrow (and I HATE returning things).
customer_reviews.author: David - Las Vegas, NV - USA

customer_reviews.title: color looks great. Bezels are not as thin as advertised by ...
customer_reviews.text: When the monitor first arrived, colors were very washed out. After calibrating the monitor, color looks great. Bezels are not as thin as advertised by the pictures (Hate when manufacturers do that.) Use google to search for calibrating your monitor. It will walk you through calibrating the monitor if you are using Windows 10. Also make sure to go into windows display settings to set the monitor to 75hz. The monitor is smooth in gaming and I really can notice a bit of difference with 75hz. At $87 I would say that it's worth it after calibration.
customer_reviews.author: Jerald

customer_reviews.title: This monitor has major issues for docking a laptop
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this monitor for my home office. My routine is to take my laptop with me, and reconnect when I get home. This monitor took constant attention in order - unplugging and trying again several times. Now, after only a few weeks of ownership, I can't even get it to turn on after 10 minutes of messing with it this morning. This piece of junk is not worth the affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: k polich

customer_reviews.title: Monitor mounters beware
customer_reviews.text: This is a good computer monitor.... if you're not planning on mounting it on a wall or monitor arms. When I attached the mounting plate the HDMI ports actually receded into the monitor itself making for a loose connection (I did not tighten even a half of the way in with the mounting screws either). I've basically had to tape my HDMI into the back of the monitor as it falls out so often. Same goes with the power cable, it doesn't seat well. Picture quality is ok. Although after 2 weeks I already have a slight burn in. I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Yearzerrrooo

customer_reviews.title: Defective (but good service)
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work! The size was good, seemed pretty solid, and came right on when I plugged it in. But it was defective - everything on screen tinted bright red and a little fuzzy. On the plus side - amazon customer service was amazing and the tech walked me patiently through several steps to try to get it adjusted, and then, when it wouldn't work - sent me the return info/label immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J.

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 5 out of 5
customer_reviews.text: For the price this monitor cannot be beat. An awesome upgrade for anyone typically working off a laptop. Really convenient to have this in your at home office and plug a laptop right in. Truly plunge and play. I’m also impressed with the internal speakers. If I even need another I will absolutely buy again. Only issue is the base that is shipped with it is the the same in the amazon listing. The frame now has no hole for cable management. I would buy again. I hope this was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: A month after my return window closed I got a dark line growing each day. It started as a small 1/4" line in which I figured I'd deal with it considering the price I paid I could live with it. Then after a few weeks it started to streak down to almost half the screen now. I'll be finding out how good the manufacturer honors their 1 year defect warranty. I'll update how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: How is this a product?
customer_reviews.text: The ports on the back of the monitor are impossible to use. The holes are too deep and vga or hdmi can’t be properly plugged in. Even with the hdmi included with the monitor. You can tap the hdmi and it will unplug from the monitor. Vga has no way of being connected. The screws can’t attach at all due to the port being too deep. Either way, I can’t get signal from the monitor to my pc. Also If you have a monitor desk mount this monitor will be hard to attach or require long screws. There’s a metal piece sticking out from the center of the back of the monitor between all four screw holes.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE - False advertising
customer_reviews.text: They are showing two different monitors in their pictures! I bought this twice and ended up with two DIFFERENT monitors. The first was the Edgeless monitor, shown in the first few pictures on the listing. The second had a different frame and stand and looks washed out, when compared to the other. This was unexpected. The color is better on the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got this monitor because it is the most light weight in its size (22in) that I could find -- less than 5 pounds. I'm very happy with the quality -- had to adjust the brightness settings though because it looked washed out when I first turned it on. Love that it has speakers in it. I am using it with a VESA mount. It came with some spacers so that the mounting plate could go on -- see pics. Also great price for a 1080p monitor. There is no glare either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adjust resolution & settings for perfect picture
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality, perfect packaging, easy features to use. I had to really work with the resolution settings to get the picture to display properly as my 2nd monitor for my laptop. Once I adjusted the advanced settings and changed from a default to a different refresh rate, it worked very well. Sometimes, when I hover over an info box, it doesn’t appear correctly, but small price to pay for generally perfect picture. It’s so nice to have HDMI directly to my laptop instead of having to use a connector.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Blurry
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use for my home office and hated it. I am a data programmer and dont need it to be fancy like most gamers would but the quality was awful and since I was using my laptop as one of my monitors I couldnt stand the difference in quality. This monitor was cheap and I returned the second without opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Smith

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality lacks a bit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 22 inch monitor and a 24 inch viewsonic for a dual monitor setup. Both 75hz. The 24 inch viewsonic absolutely outshines the 22 inch sceptre out of the box. Maybe I need to adjust some settings on this monitor to get a better picture? I haven’t really tried since I just use the viewsonic 24 inch as my primary gaming monitor, and this sceptre is the 2nd screen. Stand is nice, and solid for the price. But next to a similar priced monitor, it’s flaws are shown.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: Frameless bezel with thin chassis - NOT
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT for the frameless bezel! I've ordered this item once and the 20 inch version twice and always get the WRONG MONITOR. The one I received it NOT the one pictured. Can't express how frustrated I am right now. It clearly says in the description that this is for the frameless model, but that isn't what I was sent. I've been without a monitor for a month now because this company can't seem to get it straight. I'm beyond irritated. I've ordered monitors from this company before and had no problem, but this does not make for a good trend.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Inputs not Working, No Signal Detected
customer_reviews.text: Not only was the shipping two days late than originally scheduled, I spent 5 hours rearranging and doing cable management for my dual monitor setup after work. I was excited to get my battlestation going and when I turned everything on, I did not get any signal. I troubleshooted everything from thinking the HDMI ports were mislabeled, to reinstalling Windows & display drivers. This is a problem that only some have experienced out of the box, but I was unfortunately part of that crowd now too. I will NEVER purchase another Sceptre product again. I DO NOT RECOMMEND this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: HDMI and speakers
customer_reviews.text: Needed a quick monitor to support a Mac Pro and an Ubuntu server. This turned out far better than I planned. Picture quality is fine for me. I don't do graphics or video editing nor gaming, so I can't speak to its suitability for them. For me, the dual HDMI connections are perfect for sharing this with both systems. My bonus came in the fact that it has simple builtin speakers. The Ubuntu server has never had sound as it has no audio card or output. However, the server recognized the HDMI and was able to funnel sound out to this monitor. Now I can test apps on the server and hear them. Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Fixit

customer_reviews.title: Picture this
customer_reviews.text: Great display of visuals. They recommend 150% and it's a little strange to get used to it. Colors, contrast and brightness are great. The big let down was the sound. Very, very low and sounds like string with tin can. Had to hook-up external speakers after 5 minutes. Of course, if it had great sound and a great picture it would be more expensive. I don't do games so unable to review
customer_reviews.author: Ann S.

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: With all the Zoom calls we're doing these days having a second monitor is very helpful. I put the Zoom window on my laptop and anything I need to reference during the call on this monitor. The picture and sound quality are good, I've even taken a break now and then to watch a show without bothering to go to a big screen TV in another room. For the price it's a very good monitor. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Denver

customer_reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised and impressed
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an elderly friend who wanted something bigger than her 13" laptop screen. I was very impressed by how sharp and bright it was. The monitor was super light and easy to move around. The base is pretty crappy, but you can't expect much for this price. The picture was spectacular for a monitor of this class. Very vivid and crisp. Colors were rich and to my eyes (a graphic designer and photographer who works on many over the top, painstakingly calibrated monitors) pretty dang accurate. Viewing angles were decent. Not amazing, but very good. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: enero30

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, great image!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a simple monitor for work, and this really filled the need. Fits nicely on my desk alongside my other monitor. Plugged it into my computer, and the image came up quickly and was nice and clear. Highly recommended for anyone looking for something easy to use for a work-from-home setup, or trying to get an extra monitor for the office!
customer_reviews.author: Jake W.

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this screen! I use it for work, watching netflix, shopping too much on Amazon. The color seems just a little off though; I've messed with the brightness and tried to make it a little more yellow to cancel out some of the blue light but even still, no matter what adjustments I've tried, the color is duller than my laptop that I have connected to this monitor. Having said that, it is not that bad and still definitely would recommend for the price!
customer_reviews.author: loholle

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: I've had many monitors over the years. I'm finding they seem to be getting more affordable as time passes. I have two Sceptres now .. one that's 31" and this one which is 22". Excellent picture for the price.... in fact, paying more seems unnecessary for my work with audio and video production. My only complaint? The power cord is not a standard three-pronged plug used by computers and other monitors. The plug that goes into a power outlet is one of those bulky-shaped things... that takes up space in an extension tree or wall outlet. But other than that, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: jazzlover

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely cheap
customer_reviews.text: A 22" monitor for 80-ish dollars? What could go wrong? I'm working from home, as many people are now, so I wanted a monitor to extend my computer's real estate. I bought this monitor and I think my expectations were too high. My eyes have a really difficult time reading text on this monitor. The screens on both of my laptops are brighter and offer better clarity than the Sceptre. In an absolute pinch, I suppose this monitor is better than nothing, but my advice is to spend a few more bucks and get something of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: P. Robler

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful monitor, SCEPTRE does it again!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, Inhave always loved the look.and quality of Sceptre monitors, and this one is beautiful brilliant and exactly what I.needed. Comes with metal standoffs for vesa wallmounts, is light but heavy enough to feel substantial and not chinzy and has a beautiful display with just enough options I want and none I don't. Paired with a chromecast, its just a beautiful display solution for sharing.video from a centrally located media pc or the net direct. It is BEAUTIFUL. The speakers are not terribly loud, but thats okay for my needs and there is a headphone jack.on.the back for external speakers if needed :) TWO Hdmi inputs on.back and a vga if you are still living in the dark ages.
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes

customer_reviews.title: Same model # TWO DIFFERENT MONITORS!!!  Absolutely Irritated!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these monitors - same model number - 22 inch - and got two completely different monitors even though they are the same product numbers. One is actually a 22 inch version that has a very thin bezel, the other - has a half inch bezel completely around the entire picture...making the monitor a lot bigger overall...and BTW not matching the first one I bought. It doesn't match the photo - and what gets me really upset is that it is a good monitor, I just really wish they would have kept it consistent regardless of what they sent! Not cool at all. Will return to get correct monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor for home office
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger screen and one at eye level than my laptop since I’ll be working from home for quite some time and this monitor is perfect. I’m only using it for office work and video conferencing but the picture quality is excellent. The stand is a fixed height but you can tilt the screen for adjusting the viewing angle for your height. It has several presets for brightness and color but also a custom selection that allows you to adjust everything to your preference. It also came with a HDMI cord, which I did not see in the description and at least 1 answered question claimed it didn’t, so unless my model is different mine came with one.
customer_reviews.author: Dave321

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor esp for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was so frustrated with my other monitor - I use two for my at home business. I decided to look for something else and found this one, which was exactly what I needed and for a fabulous price. Shipped quickly, very well packaged for product protection, plug & play, simple. Highly recommend. Love that it's slim and stable, great size for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: EthanJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyday desktop monitor
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I purchased two of these for my home office. You won't get the awesome HD quality that you would get from the premium brands, but you're also saving $400-$500! That said, I work with windows and office software all day and they are perfectly fine. I don't need top of the line HD resolution for spreadsheets. :-) Streaming channels and videos are good quality HD. Not my Samsung TV good, but perfectly acceptable and I would imagine that the difference is mostly unnoticeable for most. Overall a good buy. I may come back to comment on durability after I've had them for a year or two. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mincho

customer_reviews.title: I run two of these in a dual monitor setup!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these about 6 months ago and they are still doing great! I use these on my personal laptop and desktop. I love how it has 2hdmi ports so I can easily switch between workstations! I also have two small girls that use these as well and they have handle spills and some rough service as how kids like to poke and grab the screen. 5stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Descent monitors if you don't have dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: The monitor seemed descent at first. For $80 it had great picture quality and a crisp display. The dual HDMI input was also nice and they each came with their own cable. I had been using them for work and 3D modeling and they seemed to be pretty good for that. It was only after a few days that I noticed the dead pixels in both displays I had ordered. It seems this is a consistent issue with these displays. I ended up returning and ordering Acer displays that my wife has been using.
customer_reviews.author: Z.Wright

customer_reviews.title: Does not display anymore
customer_reviews.text: Not even two months later the unit does not wanna display anymore. Regardless of what I hook up to it. Blue LED light powers on indicating power, but unit has black screen consistently. Narrowed it to likely it being a faulty Power plug-in input, as if I try applying enough pressure to the power plug behind the unit it will display briefly. I hooked it up once and the cable has not had pressure or regular movement to cause any wear to this unit's plugin. I should not be experiencing this issue ._.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Garza

customer_reviews.title: POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: What the hell? I was never told to return the defective monitor...now I being charged for another monitor?!? BS I had trouble trying to find a place to report this. So tired of sub-par customer service, that doesn’t seem to fully communicate issues and resolutions due to language barriers. So frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Gina R S

customer_reviews.title: I got two of them
customer_reviews.text: So the view of each is different even if the settings are the same. I had to adjust to color settings to match with the laptop. I use a egpu razer core x with a rtx 2080 super to run these. They are big, I can sit on my couch behind me and watch webinars comfortably. Its good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Azael Montejo Jr

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great budget monitor but mine came with dead pixels...
customer_reviews.text: The picture isn't amazing but it works as my Raspberry pi monitor for my work bench. This is an extremely affordable monitor though so it is performing above expectations. The speakers didn't work through HDMI with the Pi but I will be trying an audio cable tomorrow when I go get one. Unfortunately my star rating is heavily influenced by a dead pixel, this stuff happens but I'm still not happy about it :(
customer_reviews.author: Paul Birkholtz

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Monitor for the price with one caveat.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor to build a budget pc for my wife. Straight out the box it was very light, easy to put together, and works like a charm. The ONLY drawback really that others have mentioned is the onboard speakers arent really that loud or concise. Im not a fan of outboard speakers as im not hardcore and i have an asus monitor with onboard speakers and that one is awesome! But more expensive of course. So overall, i would reccommend this monitor and if you are an avid sound fan then i would expect to buy external speakers as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: I trade the stock markets everyday and this was a great addition to my setup. Brightness and quality is not the best but I don't need that unless I'm watching movies and playing games. The built-in blue light filter is very nice to have. Perfect for my intended use, easy to setup, no missing pixel spots, packaged well, and does have a 75 hz refresh rate. For its price and size, it's a great deal. My gf got an ONN monitor from Walmart and it is a few bucks cheaper with better brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Tyche Customer Support

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money unless u want bezeless
customer_reviews.text: Installed this monitor soon as I got took me less than 2 minutes to put up. Powered on and the picture quaily not the best but its only for my extended third screen on my imac. It will work great for me. But adjust the screen colors some and it will look wonderful. This item is worth the money. I recommend this item! This item does come with a decent hdmi cord. Thank you! Where's the bezeless design? Bait and switch mode seems like tho! Took a star for bezel and for the color could be better from start up!!!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Great monitors for the price.
customer_reviews.text: So I saw the writing on the wall that the quarantine was coming so I started getting my home office in order. I found these Scepter monitors on a few web searches, but couldn't find much for reviews so I took a chance and pulled the trigger. I have to say for a home office these are fantastic monitors. They are bright, responsive, super light-weight, and were exactly what I needed. Even though I had never heard of Sceptre before I have to say that I am completely impressed with these monitors.
customer_reviews.author: kyle swain

customer_reviews.title: Great for working from home
customer_reviews.text: I work as a data analyst from home and wanted two matching monitors that were larger than what I was working with. These were cheap, matched, and larger than the monitors I had. I have been using them for about a month and have had no issues. The text is clear on my screen the colors in my visualizations look nice as well. I don’t game through these, so I can’t talk about their performance there. But if you are an average joe computer user looking for a decent monitor. These fit the bill perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny O

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought two Scepter Monitor's to mount to a sit and stand for work. I really like the monitor's, it does come with 2 screws, 4 spacers to mount and a small screwdriver, power cord and HDMI. Only con is that it only comes with two screws each monitor and you need 4 to mount them on the back.. The small screws are not easy to find. Considering that is the only issue I have. 5 stars, good for price and great quality. :)
customer_reviews.author: Stacy R

customer_reviews.title: NOT VESA COMPATIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: Despite what the specs state, and what several reviews / questions claim, the unit is ABSOLUTELY NOT VESA compatible. It may have bolt holes arranged in a VESA pattern, but there is a large metal mounting bracket that extends from the back of the monitor preventing flush mount to a real VESA bracket. Returned immediately upon opening and discovery. VERY DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: R. Makowski Jr.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent value. I wouldn't hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the quality compared to the price. It is an excellent value. I use this for work and it does a great job. The only con so far is the fact that once the monitor is attached to the base, there is no way to adjust the monitor. It is in a fixed position. I had to put a three ring binder under the base to get the tilt I needed. This might be fixed by purchasing a monitor stand. I won't know until I get one.
customer_reviews.author: T Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monitor to use for working at home and serve as a second monitor. I needed something smaller for my desk size. This monitor has been working great, basically was plug and play. Great for the price and what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Abkno

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great. Non-standard Power Cable.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a set of these back in May for a home office setup, and overall I'm happy with them. They're hard to beat for the size and price point, but I do have two complaints. The first being that the buttons are on the backside of the monitor which can be problematic to interface with if you use a desk mount/floating mount. The second being that they don't use a standard power cord (18 AWG) which makes it difficult to plug in multiple monitors into a power strip.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Incompetent tech service
customer_reviews.text: I received a dud and the technical person either was either new or on drugs. He did not know the model number was the same as the product number or his own name! Customer service person was much better. Second shipment arrived damaged but worked. Amazon's delivery service is bad. Also it is the worst monitor I have ever bought in regards to being synchronized with the software.. Take a guess where to click to see what you want. If I could give this a zero I would. Low price but still not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Hurts My Eyes
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's just me or if I got a bad item. I can't get the picture to clear up. It's faded out. It's darker at the top of the screen and faded out at the bottom. I changed the input port. I fiddled with all the picture controls over and over. Nothing changes. I hate to send it back because I just sent back a bad speaker and I don't want to get on the "bad customer" list at Amazon. I don't think I'm going to be able to use it though. The speakers work some of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these the day that my employer said that we needed to work from home because I spend most of my day on the computer and double monitors are vital for when I'm teaching. I ordered two monitors, they are fantastic and do the job for a great price. Only thing is that they are not exactly the same, one of them is a little bit higher up on the stand than the other. But that's a small issue and doesn't make a difference in how they work.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Sceptre monitor ok Sceptre support lousy
customer_reviews.text: The image displayed was too far to the right and there are no controls built into the monitor to adjust either the vertical or horizontal size of the display. I tried to call Sceptre about this during their listed business hours and found myself in a loop. I selected technical support, it rings three times and then I am bumped back to the original menu. Called Amazon and they patiently helped me dig around in menus until we found the right one. Monitor 3 stars, Sceptre support -5 stars, Amazon support 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Art Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, decent contrast and color quality. 75hz is mediocre but fine. Paid $85 for it though, which is a great price. I bought one, and so did two of my friends. For the price it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey alexander

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle scrolling with dark backgrounds
customer_reviews.text: Any time there is a website with a dark background, scrolling up and down causes text and images to become blurry. Everything is clear once you stop, and this isn't a problem with a white backgrounds, but it is annoying every time I need to scroll.
customer_reviews.author: PDXPenName

customer_reviews.title: Good for gaming, not for working
customer_reviews.text: When I got this monitor, I tested it for work purposes and gaming purposes. For gaming, the color and picture was excellent. No complaints there. But for working (browsing, text editors, etc...) there were noticeable problems. Colors are washed out and I couldn't find any combination of settings to my satisfaction. The worst part is that there was noticeable pixelation in text on websites, especially black text on a white backgrounds. It made it hard to read webpages, which for me is essential. I ended up returning the monitor, which I really didn't want to do, but felt like I would regret keeping it. Final verdict: if you're getting this primarily for gaming I recommend it, otherwise probably not.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: 1. It is difficult to install. It takes efforts to tight the screen onto the base. 2. The picture quality is extremely bad. I've tried to adjust the set-up for a long time. But it never works. The picture is not clear enough. Anyway, this is what you get at this price for a 22' monitor. But no matter how cheap it is, it is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price paid it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Let me begin by saying that I am not a fussy monitor geek type of guy. I needed a USB style monitor to accommodate my new HP desktop tower. My old style monitor was not compatible. This works fine, was easy to set up, has lots of ways to refine the picture but I did not use any of them. Open the box, hook it up, and you are good to go. The only complaint I have is that sometimes the volume of the speakers is low, even when it is set to the highest setting. It may be operator failure and I can live with that occasional problem since 90% of the time the speaker(s) work just finel.
customer_reviews.author: CabanaBoy

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: 5 weeks into use, a horizontal line developed mid-screen...next day, it was wider, day 3 was up to 1/8" & today it's a 1/4" wide. Sceptre said call Amazon since it's new, Amazon says call Sceptre as it's past the "return date". Take my advice, buy ELSEWHERE where you can receive service when the product goes to hell. Amazon no longer cares, PRIME shipping went up in cost & no longer is a 2-day service - Amazon is becoming the Sears & Roebuck of the internet!!!!! NOW up to 2 3/8" horizontal bars about 2" apart....and NO ONE wants to accept blame or call me back about this! SCEPTRE is a friggin' JOKE at Customer Service!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: William E Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Off brand but as good as the name brands.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. We're talking less than two minutes. The color clarity is better than some name brands I've had over the years. So easy to use. So easy to love. An uncomplicated monitor. This is a wide screen. After seeing this one and the amazing picture, I'm never going back to the other kind. This is a great monitor at a great price. The quality is exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and hooked it straight my ps4 to test it. Its a good monitor and has a nice refresh rate. Comes with an hdmi cable, screw driver, stand, and mounting hardware. I just used the stand and its real easy to setup. I didnt see any pixel problems and the built in sound is decent, but dont expect it to be incredible. The price is good and the quality is. Not a bad buy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great 2nd Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I buy many dual monitor setups. This is a great cheap monitor for that need. Comes beautifully packaged with a magnetized Philips screwdriver with a rubber handle which was surprising and a nice touch. A lot of value for the money. This will only see office duty - no gaming so I cannot comment there. As for everything else, it is perfect. Now my third one.
customer_reviews.author: InformedJoe

customer_reviews.title: Great until stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a second monitor for my work laptop at home. Was very pleased with the monitor at first and suggested a family member buy one too. I thought it was a great value. However, after 7 months of use it's stopped working -- I had to unplug for a move and when I set-up again it's not working. Now the blue power light blinks and the monitor will not turn on. Monitor is black with some brief flashes of light. Seems that I'll have to get rid of it and buy a new monitor.
customer_reviews.author: knonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great quality monitors for working from home
customer_reviews.text: I don't really know what monitor on a budget entails. I am an accountant working from home and have two of these hooked up to my laptop docking station. The picture quality is great! I cannot speak for the sound quality on the monitors themselves, I have never used a speaker on a monitor. The price is good and Amazon was able to ship them to Alaska, which makes me 100% happy! I don't see any dead pixels aforementioned in the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Display Issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor last April and noticed hair line crack which is attributed to broken LCD light along the edge within 6 months. I could live with this, however for past 2 months my monitor turns off and on frequently for no reason. All connections seems to be good. Looking back I should have shelled extra 50 bucks to buy a quality monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Diffuser

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful monitor, has speakers built in:-)
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of 22" these monitors. They work with Windows and Mac both just having an appropriate adapter for Mac air. I was amazed to hear the music while my daughter was taking online classes i this COVID-19 season. My wife can also connect her office Dell laptop with HDMI port effortlessly. I will buy two more of these monitors. However my daughter told me that it gets little hot and then it goes blank/dark for few seconds and comes right back up. No issues so far. She is using it for two weeks now. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kirti Chaturvedi

customer_reviews.title: Great Price. Good Picture Quality. Good Response Time.
customer_reviews.text: Used for gaming. Monitor has good response time. Colors are good. I do not have a Color Calibration Tool, but the colors look correct. Brightness is good. Blacks are good. No backlight bleeding. No dead/stuck pixels. Settings for best quality: Output Color Depth: 12bpc Output Color Format: RGB Output Dynamic Range: Full Only one complaint overall: Comes with a VGA cable. Should come with a DVI or HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Dart Wolf Paws

customer_reviews.title: Poor picture quality
customer_reviews.text: This monitor works fine for gaming, but that's about it. The picture quality is poor, cannot use for photo editing with Adobe Lightroom. The colors look very washed out, it is much lighter than the other two monitors in my set-up. Tried adjusting the contrast on the monitor, and the settings are not very customizable. Replacing this monitor with a different brand after just a few months. Would not purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with it. I wanted to send it back for a larger one but I didn't.l, because it was exactly as advertised. I wish they had an upgrade button on Amazon becausee as a business woman I don't think sellers that do a good job should have stuff sent back. Good price, good quality, good product.
customer_reviews.author: Honest One

customer_reviews.title: Came scratched
customer_reviews.text: This monitor came with a scratch on the left side of the panel, about half an inch long. I feel like maybe it was open box before I got it, but that's not what it was advertised as. I am only using it at work, so I just deal with it.. but I wouldn't recommend buying this brand unless you just need a cheap monitor for generic display purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Zach P.

customer_reviews.title: OK monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, not a bad monitor for the price. Bought two of the monitors, and each of them show at least one bad pixel as soon as I took them out of boxes. One of them seems having trouble with input from hdmi1. I have to plug into hdmi2 to get it working. I didn’t expect much because of the price, but it barely met my expectations. I wouldn’t recommend it if you have more budget.
customer_reviews.author: Haopeng Wang

customer_reviews.title: Solid Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a while back and wanted to really put it through its paces before I reviewed it. It's a good solid monitor. My only gripe (and it's a small one) is that we have 1 dead pixel so far. Having said that, it's just one and no others have shown up, so I'm still quite happy with it. The color and brightness is good. For the price, I can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Workplace/Shop Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a PC monitor in my workshop. It arrived perfect with no dead pixels. The monitor looks great and functions perfectly, even in extreme hot/cold shop temperatures. It is certainly not a great monitor for gaming, but works well for reviewing spreadsheets and schematics. For the price, this is a good monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixel on brand new unit.
customer_reviews.text: Came with a dead pixel on screen. Not able to return, since I need it to work from home right now and can’t be without it. Saw that other reviews mentioned this, but bought anyway. It was the cheapest monitor in its size/resolution, so I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: We love these monitors!
customer_reviews.text: A+ monitors for cheap. We now own 4 of these (2 for each of my kid's gaming setups). They love them! They are clear, and crisp with images, and handle gaming on a daily basis just fine. I will continue to support this company's products. Well worth the money invested! One flaw: NO DISPLAY PORTS! But not a huge issue unless your video cards only use DP, then you will need adapters and cables to convert to HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: clara

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 5-6 weeks... then failed
customer_reviews.text: We were sequestered elsewhere for the COVID-19 crisis. I received this monitor at my new location and it worked great for 5-6 weeks I used it there. Packed it it’s original package and took it home. At home it rarely displayed a picture, but when it did, it had a horrible flicker at 40Hz... Called their support line, after diagnostics, they wanted me to RMA the unit, and not get a replacement for 3-6 weeks. I sent it back to the seller for a replacement instead.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Solid value here
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with my purchase. I bought it as a second monitor, and it does the job. It's a rather unspectacular monitor - but that's OK for the price. It delivers full 1080p, has built in VESA mount, 2x HDMI and VGA. I've had it 2 months and it hasn't failed. The blue LED light however is HORRIBLE- as in offensively bright - it's like a laser beam in the dark. Almost warrants -1 star, but the fix is so easy (tiny bit of black tape) I'll give them a pass.
customer_reviews.author: BTG

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for an Arcade Cabinet Monitor
customer_reviews.text: This monitor fits perfectly in the Gameroom Solutions Deluxe Arcade kit. I hooked it up to a Retropie and added some speakers (make sure to adjust the volume in the Retropie program). The VESA mounting holes are a little low so I could only use two of the four holes but it is holding strong and does not move with that configuration.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget 1080p monitors!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these 1080 p monitors for my dual monitors set up! I love how thin and light they are. The 75 MHz is a plus for gaming, the speakers are really low, but I don’t use them anyways but is a nice bonus to have. My only wish is that they had a DisplayPort plug along with the hdmi and vga plug.
customer_reviews.author: raymond marin

customer_reviews.title: Solid monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I set this up bedside to game at night on my ps4. It looks good, slightly muted colors but nothing terrible. Better than expected for the price. The sound, however, is trash. Expect to use external speakers or plug in headphones. Not a dealbreaker for me but worth mentioning in a review.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Not a "frameless bezel" monitor as described
customer_reviews.text: Monitor isn't amazing in the first place. Colors are washed out, not sharp. Hey fine, I knew I was buying a budget monitor. But when your product description says "Frameless bezel with thin chassis", and the photos show pretty monitors with a tiny bezel, I think it's reasonable to expect one. The monitor I actually got has a 1/2" thick, ugly bezel on it. Since the thin bezel is what swayed me to Spectre instead of better brands, all I can say is ya got me Spectre. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice monitor, and when you factor in the price, a really great deal. The only thing I have a problem with is the base. It does not have a tilt adjustment, and as assembled, has a slight downward tilt which is not ideal for my viewing situation. It's not a real problem, I just put a spacer underneath the front, but it seems odd that something that is not adjustable would not be set at a 90 degree angle.
customer_reviews.author: mistice rayne

customer_reviews.title: Great start for a gaming rig
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor as part of my first gaming rig and use it as my main monitor. It is a great starting point for someone just getting into PC gaming due to the price and features. The menu is a little difficult to get through because the buttons on the back are all low profile and feel exactly the same. The resolution is 1080p as described and it's capable of 75 frame refresh rate. I have noticed that I do have a single dead pixel on the screen but it's not that noticeable and for something so cheap and for someone just starting out it's overall pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Super great monitor for such a great price
customer_reviews.text: Such a beauty. Especially upgrading from an 07 TV, this monitor hits it out the park by so many miles. Crispy clean imagery. Bunch of settings to mess around with for your liking. Volume can be low at times, but only on Twitch which isn't a big deal. I'm usually wearing a headset or earbuds anyways. Price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ADDITION TO MY INDOOR BIKE TRAINER SET-UP...USED WITH FIRE STICK AND APPLE TV
customer_reviews.text: GREAT ADDITION TO MY INDOOR BIKE TRAINER SET-UP. I USE THIS WITH THE AMAZON FIRE STICK IN ONE HDMI PORT AND MY APPLE TV IN THE SECOND HDMI PORT. I'VE ADDED AN OLDER ECHO DOT FOR HANDS-FREE VOICE CONTROL AND AMPLIFIED COMPUTER SPEAKERS (THE MONITOR'S INTERNAL SPEAKERS ARE NOT VERY LOUD). SET-UP TOOK ONLY MINUTES.
customer_reviews.author: Twee

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive, monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Updated: 1-star changed to 4. Originally appeared to be two defective monitors, however found 2 of 3 HDMI cables that had issues - even though they worked on other devices. Video quality is reasonable for the cost. Audio volume is a bit low, even all the way up. Build quality feels a bit flimsy. Overall, a good value, though.
customer_reviews.author: Wag D'Tail

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and clear monitor
customer_reviews.text: This slim monitor displays a crystal clear picture and it is very affordable compared to other items I looked at before buying this monitor. It has some cool menu functions like the power saver when it's not in use. It very light and slim. I loved this monitor and will recommend it to others as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ultimalexy

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy with this screen (though I bought two and the 2nd one didn't work--which can happen with anything, IMO). It has good picture quality with solid adjustability, decent sound, and seems to be well-made. I don't think it would be a good product for someone doing video or graphic design work--they would need a higher resolution in the picture quality and probably sound quality, but for basic office work and social media, it's the right screen for the right price!
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Thornback

customer_reviews.title: Flawless, great value.
customer_reviews.text: My brother is using it currently, we haven't pushed it past 60hz because his PC can barely handle that usually so I kept it lower to prevent stuttering while gaming. Great monitor, default color setting was a bit washed out but using the built in options we got it to our standards pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Impressed and happy, good buy great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this monitor for work from home use. Mounted on my wall and use it as a second monitor to my work laptop. Works perfect for me, very nice monitor, resolution, brightness. Very happy with my purchase, thinking of buying another one and just run dual screens instead of laptop monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Mark e Rosas

customer_reviews.title: Decent Monitors. Not sure of longevity
customer_reviews.text: Monitors look great right out of the box. The only issue is a pixel has already gone out and it hasnt even been two months of using the screen. Other reviews had warned about this. Overall I use for this monitor for work and not gaming so these do the job for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lopez423

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal
customer_reviews.text: I have never before bought a Sceptre product before, I just wanted an affordable monitor for my security system. Turns out this things is GREAT for the money and unlike most monitors now a days, comes with all the cables you need to get it hooked up. Way to go Sceptre.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fluharty

customer_reviews.title: Clear and crisp images, excellent picture.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I turned it on the clarity and brightness of the picture immediately grabbed my full attention. Compared to my old monitor it was like going from black and white, grainy to picture perfect, full spectrum color. (And my old monitor is a very good brand and highly rated, just a little smaller than the new one). Cannot be more please with the great deal I got and the high quality performance of the Sceptre monitor.
customer_reviews.author: David Strader

customer_reviews.title: Will not take HDMI camera input
customer_reviews.text: This unit displays my laptop screen accurately and crisply; however, it will not display the HDMI input from my Sony camera (micro HDMI to standard HDMI) -- only the audio from the camera comes through. The audio level is very very low. I'd give it a 5 for picture, 3 for audio. I don't know why it will not take the camera HDMI signal, so I will have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm! Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My monitor came and it worked like a charm. No issues with pixels like some other reviews. This is a great buy for the price offered! Note: This item came with an HDMI to HDMI cord. There's no need to buy the extra one offered on this page unless you need one 6 feet long.
customer_reviews.author: brian hogan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IT PLEASE!!!!!! Save your money for a better monitor
customer_reviews.text: First of all they claim it to be 75Hz (refresh rate). NOT IT’s NOT!!! It will come out 59Hz. Second, the picture that they’re showing WILL NOT BE the item you will receive. And lastly. There’s a lot of dead pixels (out of the box). PLEASE DON’T BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jenivieve s.

customer_reviews.title: Can't Hear you...
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good monitor. Very to set up, and a very clear picture. The reason I got this was because it had a built in speaker. The speaker is garbage!!! I have it jacked up at it's highest level and can barely hear it while I am sitting like 2 feet away!! If sound is important to you, pick out something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kage

customer_reviews.title: Surprising value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these (22") to set up a dual monitor system. I knew I was taking a risk in selecting a minor brand, but that was balanced by the cost. These are not $300 monitors, so I had lowered my expectations about performance. However, I was pleasantly surprised by this product. I definitely feel like I have gotten plenty of value with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap good monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a travel monitor. I install CCTV systems and I use this to program the DVRs. Its light weight, looks good. Seems fairly durable in terms of monitors. Its safe to say this thing has had a rough life. We are pretty hard on this thing and it hasn't missed a beat.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The screen is way to dim (played with settings and best I can do is not bright enough). The picture is side by side monitor test vs a Lenova Thinkvision, which is slightly more expensive. Not much better than working off of laptop for second screen.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Reed

customer_reviews.title: Home office completed
customer_reviews.text: Welp the pandemic and eventual remote officing forced me to upgrade my home office and this was a perfect fit. It's a great size and has allowed me to return to the land of two screens which increases productivity. Definitely worth the $$...great VALUE!
customer_reviews.author: Olakunle Ekundare

customer_reviews.title: TLDR - decent generic second monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement 2nd monitor (death by an over excited cat) for my home office. It came with a HDMI cable, VESA screws and a light weight plastic stand. It worked fine out of the box, set up took me 10 minutes. The speakers are worse than listening to music on your cell phone's speaker.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Okay for the price is it feels like a great deal 1080p with 2hdmi ports an built in speakers, an this size is perfect for small gaming set up but the color seemed a bit washed out for my taste an the speakers are not as loud as I hoped or expected, but I can see why that my be the case as this might be a monitor used in office of some sort an a loud monitor might be distracting. Overall I am content with the product an the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Lara-Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Multiple dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: I can only give this product 3 stars as both monitors I ordered came with multiple dead pixels. The packaging was outstanding and no other scratches of missing parts but two monitors with multiple dead pixels is not normal. Good thing I only use these as work monitors; I would never recommend these for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Soward

customer_reviews.title: 75hz only on DP
customer_reviews.text: hdmi1.4 should be able to handle 1080p @ 75hz, but the option isn't there. It only shows up when using DP. That said, it's a little bright, but settings allow adjusting this. The cost is nice and i like sceptre.
customer_reviews.author: Will
